readability_reflection: I found interpolation more readable because it is easier to just plug in the variable without dealing with all the + signs. I think the + signs make it more confusing especially if there are numbers in the string.
comprehension_debugging: No, in fact, I think that helped me to debug it even faster. It was easy to just plug in whatever variable it was.
preference_rationale: I prefer string interpolation. It is much more readable and less confusing to look at.
learning_curve: I've had very minimal experience with both, so there really was no impact with either. I've used string interpolation in python a few times and I have only used string concatenation in c++ for some exercises.
suggestions_improvement: Perhaps a different symbol can be used for string concatenation.
